description: From Middle English meeltime, from Old English mǣltīma (“mealtime”), equivalent to meal +‎ time. Compare mealtide, Old English mǣltīd (“mealtime”), Dutch maaltijd (“meal”), German Mahlzeit (“meal, mealtime”), Danish måltid (“meal, mealtime”), Icelandic máltíð (“meal”), Icelandic matmálstími (“mealtime”).

entries.meaning: The appointed time at which a meal is served or eaten.
examples: My youngest son has a special cry for mealtimes.
